name: Child Count for State Level
dataViewDescription: State-level data on the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA) Part B, including an unduplicated count of children with disabilities receiving special education from ages 3 through 21 served by the Office of Special Education Programs (OSEP).
step2Description: For creating Child Count and Educational Environments reports, load data collected from FS002 and FS089.
step3Description: Review the summary of your data view below. After checking the details, proceed to the next step to save your data view.
step4Description: Before saving, please be sure to give your data view a unique name and a good description.

files.name: FS089 - Children with Disabilities (IDEA) Early Childhood
files.description: The unduplicated number of children with disabilities (IDEA) who are ages 3 through 5 and not in kindergarten and receiving special education and related service according to an individualized education program (IEP), an individualized family service plan (IFSP), or a services plan in place on the state's child count date.

database.query: select * from RDS.ReportEDFactsK12StudentCounts where ReportCode = 'c089' and ReportLevel = 'sea' and ReportYear = ${reportingYear}

files.name: FS002 - Children with Disabilities (IDEA) School Age
files.description: The unduplicated number of children with disabilities (IDEA) who are ages 5 (in kindergarten) through 21 and receiving special education and related service according to an individualized education program (IEP) or a services plan in place on the state's child count date.

database.query: select * from RDS.ReportEDFactsK12StudentCounts where ReportCode = 'c002' and ReportLevel = 'sea' and ReportYear = ${reportingYear}
